title: What was the song Paul McCartney wrote for his wife Linda called? - Quora

response.answer_text: One of the very first songs he wrote for and about her was Maybe I’m Amazed. There are really too many songs he wrote for her to mention, Here is what Paul said about the subject. Paul told PEOPLE in 1993. “My Love,” “No More Lonely Nights,” “The Lovely Linda”—one of the world’s best songwriters could not stop putting his feelings into music. “Any love song I write,” Paul said last year, “is written for Linda.” Paul was a very loving and loyal husband and by all accounts Linda was a great wife and they really were a happy couple. So no doubt many of his songs were based on their life together even songs that were exactly love songs like Another day. Even as the Beatles as someone else mentioned he wrote Two Of Us which was on the Let It Be album.

You can pretty much take any love song recorded by Paul between 1970 and 1997 and know it was written for Linda. The most famous ones are probably Maybe I’m Amazed and My Love. There are some other gems out there though. Long Haired Lady is a favourite of mine along with Golden Earth Girl. The latter focuses on Linda’s love of nature. Daytime Nightime Suffering was written when Linda was having restless nights after their youngest was born. Warm and Beautiful and Somedays are other notables.
